item.title: 布兰德斯基金以欧洲廉价股票抗衡美国科技股涨势
item.description: 欧洲表现最好的股票基金之一没有押注英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）或苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：One of Europe’s best-performing equity funds has matched the steep gains of US tech without betting on the likes of Nvidia Corp. or Apple Inc. — instead by buying some of the region’s most undervalued stocks.】

item.title: 路透社报道：印尼下任领导人希望因德拉瓦蒂担任内阁职务
item.description: 路透社援引未具名人士的话报道称，印尼当选总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）正在考虑向现任财政部长斯里-穆利亚尼-因德拉瓦蒂（Sri Mulyani Indrawati）提供一个内阁席位。【原文：Indonesian President-elect Prabowo Subianto is considering to offer a cabinet seat to current Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, according to a report by Reuters, citing people it didn’t name.】

item.title: 新加坡将停止安联与收入保险的 17 亿美元交易
item.description: 新加坡政府正在寻求阻止安联集团（Allianz SE）以现有形式收购收入保险有限公司（Income Insurance Ltd.）多数股权的拟议交易。【原文：The Singapore government is seeking to stop a proposed deal by Allianz SE to buy a majority stake in Income Insurance Ltd. under its current form.】

item.title: 交易员权衡中国财政刺激政策和特朗普胜算，比特币跳涨
item.description: 比特币攀升至两周来的最高水平，因为市场对中国最新刺激措施的反应不一，这使得投机者更加大胆地打赌，他们将追逐加密货币，而不是中国的股票。【原文：Bitcoin climbed to the highest level in two weeks as a mixed reaction to China’s latest stimulus efforts emboldened wagers that speculators will chase after cryptocurrencies rather than the nation’s stocks.】

item.title: S&P 预计未来十年主权外债违约事件将增多
item.description: S&P Global Ratings 预测，在未来十年中，由于债务水平大幅提高和硬通货债务的借贷成本增加，主权发行人的外币债务违约将会增加。【原文：S&P Global Ratings predicts an increase in foreign-currency debt defaults among sovereign issuers over the next decade, driven by significantly higher debt levels and increased borrowing costs on hard currency obligations.】

item.title: 斯泰纳回收公司在 Northvolt 总部所在城市裁员 60 人
item.description: 在一家回收承包商宣布裁员 60 人之后，瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt AB 公司危机的连锁反应继续蔓延。【原文：The ripple effects from the crisis at Swedish battery maker Northvolt AB continue to spread after a recycling contractor announced it was laying off 60 workers.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将在第二周下跌后下挫
印度债券遭遇纳入指数以来的首次单周资金外流
item.description: 有资格被纳入全球债务的印度主权债券自被纳入摩根大通公司的新兴市场债券指数以来首次出现每周资金外流。【原文：Indian sovereign bonds that are eligible for global debt inclusion saw their first weekly outflow since getting added to JPMorgan Chase & Co’s emerging-market bond index.】

item.title: Kyivstar 所有者 Veon 将把总部从阿姆斯特丹迁至迪拜
item.description: 拥有乌克兰最大移动公司 Kyivstar 的无线运营商 Veon Ltd. 表示，计划将总部从阿姆斯特丹迁往迪拜。【原文：Veon Ltd., the wireless operator that owns Ukraine’s largest mobile company Kyivstar, said it’s planning to move its headquarters from Amsterdam to Dubai.】

item.title: 中国公司宣布海上风力涡轮机规模实现巨大飞跃
item.description: 中国东方电气集团（Dongfang Electric Corp.）宣布制造出一种新的涡轮机，其规模远远超过该行业以前的任何产品，令海上风电行业大吃一惊。【原文：China’s Dongfang Electric Corp. has surprised the offshore wind industry with an announcement that it’s built a new turbine radically larger than anything previously available in the sector.】

item.title: 资产管理公司将澳元看涨押注提升至 2021 年以来最高水平
item.description: 机构投资者转而看涨澳元，为2021年3月以来最高，因为有迹象表明澳央行将把利率维持在较高水平，而中国的刺激政策也重振了市场对澳元的信心。【原文：Institutional investors turned most bullish on the Australian dollar since March 2021 as signs the nation’s central bank will keep interest rates at elevated levels and China’s stimulus push revived confidence in the currency.】

item.title: 市场重回特朗普临界点
item.description:
现在的论调已经转变为必须考虑共和党的横扫。如果通胀重燃，股市将不会一帆风顺。【原文：

The narrative has shifted to where a Republican sweep must be considered. If inflation reignites, it won’t go smoothly for stocks. 

】

item.title: 德国经济陷入衰退，2024 年将不再增长
item.description: 彭博社的一项调查显示，德国正在经历轻度衰退，整个2024年的产出将持平；这凸显了欧洲最大经济体的萎靡不振。【原文：Germany is suffering a mild recession and output across the whole of 2024 will be flat, according to a Bloomberg survey — underscoring the malaise in Europe’s largest economy.】

item.title: 调查显示，瑞士央行将再降息两次，使利率降至 0.5%
item.description: 根据彭博社的一项调查，瑞士国家银行的宽松周期将延续到明年，经济学家目前预测在即将到来的 12 月和 3 月的政策会议上还将有两次降息。【原文：The Swiss National Bank’s easing cycle will extend into next year, with economists now predicting two more interest-rate cuts at the upcoming December and March policy meetings, according to a Bloomberg survey.】

item.title: 欧元区就业市场降温引发欧洲央行加快减息步伐的呼声
item.description: 欧元区的劳动力市场在经历了多年出人意料的韧性之后，终于出现了裂痕；这促使欧洲中央银行更快地降低利率。【原文：Cracks are finally appearing in the euro zone’s labor market after years of unexpected resilience — spurring the European Central Bank to lower interest rates more speedily.】

item.title: 中国政府承诺提供资金后，中国地方政府融资债券反弹
item.description: 在财政部采取了 "多年来最大规模 "的举措以减轻地方政府 1.6 万亿美元的债务压力之后，中国地方政府融资工具发行的债券出现反弹。【原文：Bonds issued by China’s local government financing vehicles rallied following the Ministry of Finance’s “largest-in-recent-years” initiative to relieve pressure on their $1.6 trillion debt pile.】

item.title: 新西兰第三季度消费者支出进一步下降
item.description: 新西兰第三季度的消费支出依然疲软，使经济可能已经陷入衰退的迹象更加明显。【原文：New Zealand consumer spending remained weak in the third quarter, adding to signs the economy may have been in recession.】

item.title: 亚洲历史最悠久的交易所的股票受到追捧，竞争对手新交所的交易量受到关注
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 韩国科技出口第二个月放缓，增长面临风险
item.description: 韩国政府的数据显示，韩国的技术产品出口连续第二个月放缓，这表明全球需求可能正在见顶，该数据还显示内存芯片的出货量和价格正在失去增长势头。【原文：South Korea’s exports of technology products slowed for a straight second month in an indication global demand may be peaking out, according to government data that also showed memory-chip shipments and prices losing momentum.】

item.title: 交易员评估财政支持誓言，中国股市出现波动
item.description: 由于投资者在评估财政部周末宣布的支持措施的潜在影响，中国股市周一早盘出现波动。【原文：Chinese stocks fluctuated in early trading on Monday as investors assessed the potential impact of the support measures announced by the finance ministry over the weekend.】

item.title: 受最新刺激政策影响，高盛上调中国经济增长预期
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）上调了对中国 2024 年和 2025 年经济增长的预测，此前中国政府公布了一系列支撑经济增长的措施，包括上周末宣布的增加公共支出计划。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. upgraded its forecasts for China’s economic growth in 2024 and 2025 after Beijing unveiled a series of measures to shore up growth, including plans for greater public spending announced over the weekend.】

item.title: 周末简报令中国交易员不堪重负，为波动做好准备
item.description: 2024年10月8日星期二，中国北京，行人穿过马路。中国表示有信心实现今年的经济目标，并承诺将进一步支持经济增长，尽管中国没有推出更多的重大刺激措施，这让那些希望为全球股市上涨提供更多燃料的投资者感到失望。摄影师：Gilles Sabrie/Bloomberg【原文：Pedestrians cross a road in Beijing, China, on Tuesday, Oct. 8, 2024. China said it's confident in reaching its economic targets this year and promised to further support growth, although it held back in unleashing more major stimulus in a disappointment to investors looking for more fuel for a world-beating stock rally. Photographer: Gilles Sabrie/Bloomberg】

item.title: 韩国金属帝国控制权争夺战进入最后期限
item.description: 全球最大锌冶炼厂的控制权争夺战面临着一个关键的最后期限，这可能标志着一场耗资数十亿美元的接班人争夺战的终结。【原文：The battle for control of the world’s largest zinc smelter faces a critical deadline that could mark the beginning of the end of a multi-billion dollar succession feud.】

item.title: 中国经济刺激政策令财政多头失望，大宗商品下跌
item.description: 在中国停止推出新的财政刺激措施以支撑经济之后，大宗商品价格下跌。【原文：Commodities prices dropped after China stopped short of unveiling fresh fiscal stimulus to shore up the economy.】

item.title: 台湾官员称台积电计划在欧洲建立更多芯片工厂
item.description: 据一位台湾高级官员透露，台湾半导体制造股份有限公司正计划在欧洲建立更多工厂，重点关注人工智能芯片市场，以扩大其全球业务版图。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. is planning more plants in Europe with a focus on the market for artificial intelligence chips, according to a senior Taiwanese official, as the chipmaker expands its global footprint.】

item.title: 市场综述：中国简报令亚洲投资者感到不安
item.description: 由于中国财政部周末的简报令人失望，加上工厂价格下降加剧了人们对中国经济的担忧，亚洲市场开局谨慎。【原文：Asian markets are poised for a cautious start as China’s Finance Ministry briefing at the weekend underwhelmed and a drop in factory prices added to concerns over the nation’s economy.】

item.title: 关注以色列与伊朗冲突，中国简报后石油下跌
item.description: 周六，中国财政部举行了备受瞩目的简报会，但会上没有提出新的激励措施来刺激这个最大进口国的消费，以色列打击伊朗的阴影笼罩着市场，石油随之下跌。【原文：Oil declined after China’s highly anticipated Finance Ministry briefing on Saturday lacked new incentives to boost consumption in the biggest importer, with the specter of Israeli strikes on Iran hanging over the market.】

item.title: 瓦斯特公司宣布空间站计划，接替美国国家航空航天局的国际空间站
item.description: 由前加密大亨杰德-麦卡勒布（Jed McCaleb）创办的航空航天初创公司 Vast Space 公布了其国际空间站后续计划，加入了杰夫-贝索斯的蓝色起源公司（Blue Origin）和其他希望将地球轨道商业化的公司的行列。【原文：Vast Space, the aerospace startup founded by former crypto tycoon Jed McCaleb, revealed its plans for a successor to the International Space Station, joining Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin and others hoping to commercialize Earth orbit.】

item.title: 帮助佛罗里达的 "飓风保险 "如何辜负了最贫穷的国家
item.description:
灾难债券已成为华尔街管理气候灾害风险的新宠。但是，当不幸降临时，它们可能会让脆弱的国家倒霉。【原文：

Catastrophe bonds have become Wall Street’s new favorite way to manage the risk of climate-fueled disasters. But they can leave vulnerable nations out of luck when misfortune strikes.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 投资者正在防范原油价格的潜在飙升。在地缘政治不确定性和降息的背景下，棕榈油期货正在飙升，交易商们也开始热衷于黄金交易所交易基金。【原文：Investors are protecting against a potential spike in crude prices. Palm oil futures are surging, and traders are warming up to exchange-traded funds for gold against a backdrop of geopolitical uncertainty and interest-rate cuts.】
